job_title: Residence Life Coordinator in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros:
-The staff are very welcoming
-The culture is very informal (ex. relaxed dress code)
-Great opportunities to attend interesting on-campus events
-My older colleagues have always taken a keen interest in my professional development and success
-Small school allows for a lot of genuine relationships to form
cons:
-Relies on BIPOC community members to lead DEI initiatives too much
-Pay is not competitive
-Many offices are understaffed and overworked (Lot's of 1 person offices)

job_title: Director in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros: nice people, interesting atmosphere, some flexibility with hours and fabulous benefits. It is a small enough place that you can be exposed to many departments outside your area of expertise and I think there has been a positive push to collaborate more between departments.
cons: There are certainly some difficult or entitled personalities, but I think you find those anywhere.  Housing in Bryn Mawr can be expensive (and if it isn't, it is overrun with students), but the main line offers lots of other places to live which don't make the commute too far - especially by train.

job_title: in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros: Flexible, meet a lot of great student and full-time workers this way, get to make your own food, and most people end up as supervisors at some point.
cons: Low accountability, snobby customers, and a difficult hierarchy to work around if someone on full time staff is bothering you.

job_title: Student LIbrarian in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros:
If you're a student, it's an obvious employment choice.

Air-conditioned in the summer.

Pays more than minimum wage.
cons:
Staff is nice but also does minimal work. Often caught them playing Angry Birds. 

The hours were not very flexible, I ended up leaving because they wanted me to work at least 10 hours during the 9-5 schedule and it was too much with upper-level classes. 

Considering none of my work was "time-sensitive," they were very harsh if academics ever had to be put over work.

job_title: Busser, Server, Catering, Front Desk Worker in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros:
You learn a lot about how B&Bs and restaurants work
We eat the leftovers (actually amazing food)
Coworkers are great! Many are students, but the grownups are good too.
Chef Ted made the best burger of my entire life.
cons:
Good, hard work. (one shift counts as a workout)
On your feet the whole shift
Meh pay

review_title: A women's college that is understaffed
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros: It's small and intimate, which means you get to know everyone quickly. The students are fantastic to work with and there are many co-workers who go above and beyond in their jobs.
cons: The administration is very concerned about keeping costs low. While this is understandable, it means that there is a large amount of under-staffing in administrative positions.

review_title: There is a lot to be improved at this school, and particularly in the Development Office
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros: Excellent work-life balance, Excellent benefits
cons: Terrible senior management resulting in despondent staff. This college is also stuck in its traditional ways. The staff have only just begun thinking of the college broadly as a business that needs to compete with other colleges. There also seems to be a lack of trust and faith between the faculty/staff and the current president.

job_title: Director in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros: The sense of community attempts to make every person on campus feel like a contributing member.
cons: The community effort doesn't always work. The strong culture and tradition of the campus can be alienating to those who are not alums, and the culture is very slow to change, even when that change would be for the better.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bryn Mawr, PA
pros: It's a diverse community and everyone tries to be respectful to one another. It's good for those who like being part of an intellectual community where people actually value knowledge and learning.
cons: There is definitely a lot of work to do but it is balanced by the supportive community.
